p: The small volumes of homogenate left from a single mosquito after execution of the micro-PRNT allows for a parallel PCR amplification for identification of the blood meal source (the host). The literature commonly reports that the origin of host blood meals can be identified from as a little as 0.02 μl of blood [ 30]. In our proof of principle, 10 μl aliquots of 1:20 diluted homogenate recovered from the micro-PRNT 60 hr post blood-feeding were successfully amplified and sequenced to identify our experimental donors: sheep and humans.
